dt: {bc}something toward which effort is directed {bc}an aim, goal, or end of action
{bc}a {d_link|strategic|strategic} position to be attained or a purpose to be achieved by a military operation
{bc}a {d_link|lens|lens:1} or system of lenses that forms an image of an object

pt: {sc}intention{/sc} {sc}intent{/sc} {sc}purpose{/sc} {sc}design{/sc} {sc}aim{/sc} {sc}end{/sc} {sc}object{/sc} {sc}objective{/sc} {sc}goal{/sc} mean what one intends to accomplish or attain. {sc}intention{/sc} implies little more than what one has in mind to do or bring about.
{sc}intent{/sc} suggests clearer formulation or greater deliberateness.

pt.t: being successful was her {it}purpose{/it} in life

pt: {sc}design{/sc} implies a more carefully calculated plan.

pt.t: the order of events came by accident, not {it}design{/it}

pt: {sc}aim{/sc} adds to these implications of effort directed toward attaining or accomplishing.

pt.t: her {it}aim{/it} was to raise film to an art form

pt: {sc}end{/sc} stresses the intended effect of action often in distinction or contrast to the action or means as such.

pt.t: willing to use any means to achieve his {it}end{/it}

pt: {sc}object{/sc} may equal {sc}end{/sc} but more often applies to a more individually determined wish or need.

pt.t: his constant {it}object{/it} was the achievement of pleasure

pt: {sc}objective{/sc} implies something tangible and immediately attainable.

pt.t: their {it}objective{/it} is to seize the oil fields

pt: {sc}goal{/sc} suggests something attained only by prolonged effort and hardship.

quotes.t: The first {qword}objective{/qword} of the low-intensity war was to "bleed" India so that it would cut its losses and quit.
The President had largely stuck to his publicly stated goals—though the {qword}objective{/qword} of smashing Iraq's military machine hadn't been so clear.
The Orange Plan assumed an early Japanese capture of the Philippines, and made relief of the Philippines the main U.S. {qword}objective{/qword}.
… their primary {qword}objective{/qword} is not the enrollment of new voters but changing the party affiliation of old voters …

et: in sense 1 probably short for {it}objective point{/it} "goal of a military operation"; in sense 2 noun derivative of {it}objective,{/it} adjective, "nearest the object (of the parts of a lens in a telescope, microscope, etc.)," probably borrowed from French (in {it}verre objectif{/it} "lens nearest the object") {ma}{mat|objective:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: something toward which effort is directed : an aim, goal, or end of action
a strategic position to be attained or a purpose to be achieved by a military operation
a lens or system of lenses that forms an image of an object
